intro: Acrolophia cochlearis, commonly known as the spiral orchid, is a species of orchid native to South Africa. It is characterized by its unique spiral-shaped inflorescence, which gives it its common name. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, delicate flowers in shades of white and green. It thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas. Acrolophia cochlearis is a rare and specialized orchid, adapted to specific environmental conditions.
